title: Genghis Khan's Postal System
description: A quick win: understand Genghis Khan's Postal System.

hook.text: Genghis Khan conquered the Silk Road, then did something unexpected â€” he made it safe.

buildup.text: He built the Yam, a postal relay system with stations every 25 miles across the empire.

discovery.text: Riders carried a special tablet that guaranteed food, fresh horses, and protection at every stop.

twist.text: A message could cross the entire Mongol Empire in days. Traders traveled under the same protection.

climax.text: The Pax Mongolica made the Silk Road safer than it had been in centuries. Trade boomed.

punchline.text: History's greatest conqueror became its greatest postmaster.

quiz.question: What was the Yam system?
options: A postal relay network across the Mongol Empire
